content:
Diagnosis:	Right breast cancer - T1cN0M0 mucinous carcinoma

Management:	15 Mar 2024 Wide local excision and sentinel lymph node biopsy

Histology:	Grade 1 mucinous carcinoma, 18mm, clear margins >5mm
		ER 8/8, PR 7/8, HER2 negative, Ki67 12%
		0/2 sentinel nodes involved

Current Situation:	Post-operative review prior to adjuvant therapy

I reviewed [redacted name] today following her recent breast surgery. She has made an excellent recovery with good wound healing and no post-operative complications. The final histology confirms a grade 1 mucinous carcinoma with favourable prognostic features.

We discussed adjuvant treatment options in detail. Given her stage, grade and receptor status, I have recommended adjuvant endocrine therapy with tamoxifen for 5 years. The absolute benefit of chemotherapy in her case would be less than 3% and she is happy to proceed without this. Radiotherapy will be arranged to complete local treatment.

I have prescribed tamoxifen 20mg daily to start after radiotherapy completion. She will be referred to the breast radiotherapy team this week and will return to see me in 3 months' time. Annual mammography will be arranged through the breast unit.
